document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Harmothoe Kinberg, 1856 (Polychaeta: Polynoidae) in the Northeast Atlantic

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Harmothoe Kinberg, 1856 (Polychaeta: Polynoidae) in the Northeast Atlantic

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material. Harmothoe extenuata :
neotype , designated here, NHMW ZooEv 274 (selected out of 3 spms.), Italy , Bay of Naples , leg.
1882.

Lagisca propinqua
:
holotype , SMNH-Type-2398, Sweden , Bohuslän Koster , 58°57'N 11°5'E , leg. A.V. Ljungman.

Lepidonotus dumetosus
:

:

,
1 syntype , MNHN Poly type 104, France , Granville ( Normandy ), leg. Audouin
et Milne- Edwards.

Diagnosis . Anterior pair of eyes dorsolateral at widest part of prostomium. Elytral margin with short, scattered papillae; surface covered by conical microtubercles, with a row of rounded, drop-shaped and often darkly pigmented macrotubercles near posterior margin.

Tentaculophores inserted laterally to prostomium, each with two notochaetae and a dorsal and ventral tentacular cirrus, styles of cirri papillate, abruptly tapering subdistally to filiform tip. Second segment with first pair of elytra, biramous parapodia, and long buccal cirri. Following segments with tapering, short, sparsely papillate ventral cirri.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 15.
Harmothoe extenuata
(neotype, NHMW ZooEv 274). (A) anterior end; styles of left and right dorsal and left ventral tentacular cirri missing; style of right dorsal cirrus regenerating; (B) second right elytron from segment 4; (C) detail of posterior margin of same; (D) left cirrigerous parapodium from segment 16, posterior view, style of dorsal cirrus missing; (E) distal part of long notochaeta; (F) tip of same; (G) distal part of middle neurochaeta; (H) tip of same; (I) tip of uppermost neurochaeta; (J) tip of lower neurochaeta. (Scales: A, B = 1 mm; C, E, G = 100 µm; D = 500 µm; F, H–J = 50 µm).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Measurements . Neotype of
H. extenuata
(cs), NHMW ZooEv 274 ( Fig. 15A–J ): L 32 mm , W 5 mm for 43 segments. Holotype of
L. propinqua
(af), SMNH-Type-2398: L 16 mm , W 6 mm for 28 segments.

Remarks . Fauvel (1923) synonymised
Lagisca propinqua Malmgren, 1867
and
Polynoe rarispina M. Sars, 1861
with
Lagisca extenuata ( Grube, 1840 )
; this opinion was followed by Pettibone (1953) , who consequently considered
Lagisca Malmgren, 1866
to be a junior synonym of
Harmothoe Kinberg, 1856
, and was adopted in our papers (see Barnich & Fiege 2000 and 2006 ). After having checked the available types and some more additional material of the respective species, we confirm that
L. propinqua
is a junior synonym of
H. extenuata
, since we could not find any relevant differences.
Polynoe rarispina ,
however, is a valid
Harmothoe species
which can be easily recognised due to its elytra with prominent stick-shaped macrotubercles, while
H. extenuata
has much smaller drop-shaped macrotubercles.

We looked for the holotype of
Polynoe extenuata
in the collections of the Museum of Natural History Wroclaw ( Poland ) and the Museum für Naturkunde Berlin ( Germany ), where most of Grube’s types are deposited, and also in other German museums. As the type specimen was not found, we consider it now definitely lost. Grube’s rather short description of the species added to the confusion in the literature, especially regarding its possible junior synonyms. In the course of this revision it became clear, that there is a strong need for a neotype of this species, in order to allow correct distinction of
H. extenuata
, not only from species like
L. propinqua
or
L. rarispina
, but also from a number of other species, as shown in the identification key given here. The selected neotype is a specimen in perfect condition with numerous elytra originating from the Bay of Naples, the type locality indicated by Grube (1840 : p. 2).
Distribution . Northeast Atlantic, Skagerrak, Kattegat, Öresund, North Sea, and Mediterranean Sea. Records outside this area are doubtful due to confusion with other species.
Habitat . On various substrates, in 0 to 400 m .
